contentheadline.headline: Zechariah Mendel ben Aryeh Leib of Cracow

contentrichtext.text: {{distinguish|Zechariah Mendel ben Aryeh Leib}} '''Zechariah Mendel ben Aryeh Leib''' (18th century) ([[Hebrew]]: '''זכריה מנדל בן אריה ליב''') was a [[History of Jews in Poland|Polish]] [[Talmudist]], native of [[Cracow]], and in later life chief rabbi and head of the [[yeshibah]] at [[Belz]], [[Galicia (Central Europe)|Galicia]]. He was the author of ''[[Be'er Heitev]]'', a well-known commentary on the ''[[Shulchan Aruch]]'', ''Yoreh De'ah'', and ''Ḥoshen Mishpaṭ'' (first edition of the first part, Amsterdam, 1754; of the second, ib. 1764); the work is principally a compendium of the ''Sifte Kohen'' and ''Ṭure Zahab.'' ==Jewish Encyclopedia bibliography== *Azulai, Shem ha-Gedolim, ii., s.v. Be'er Heṭeb; *Fuenn, Keneset Yisrael, p. 318. ==References== *{{JewishEncyclopedia|url=http://www.jewishencyclopedia.com/view.jsp?artid=67&letter=Z|article=Zechariah Mendel ben Aryeh Löb}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mendel, Zechariah}} [[Category:Early Acharonim]] [[Category:18th-century rabbis]] [[Category:18th-century Polish people]] [[Category:People from Kraków]] [[Category:Polish Orthodox rabbis]] {{poland-rabbi-stub}}
